media:group.media:title: GraphQL Caching on the Edge
media:group.media:description:
QCon Plus, the online software development conference organized by InfoQ, is returning this November 30-December 8, with an international community of senior software engineers, architects, and team leaders joining. Don’t miss your chance to be part of this event!
Save your spot now: https://bit.ly/3RvbhpN --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Video on InfoQ: https://bit.ly/3NDo618
Max Stoiber discusses why and how to edge cache production GraphQL APIs at scale.
This presentation was recorded at QCon Plus November 2021: https://plus.qconferences.com/

media:group.media:title: Understanding JIT Optimizations by Decompilation
media:group.media:description:
QCon Plus, the online software development conference organized by InfoQ, is returning this November 30 - December 8, with an international community of senior software engineers, architects, and team leaders joining. Don’t miss your chance to be part of this event!
Save your spot now: https://bit.ly/3RvbhpN --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Video on InfoQ: https://bit.ly/3ejB2Ms
Chris Seaton shows how they have developed a pseudo-code decompiler for optimized Java code, and how it helps them understand how the Java JIT compiler is working in order to improve their code.
This presentation was recorded at QCon Plus November 2021: https://plus.qconferences.com/

entry.title: VR Environments for Collaborative Software Development

media:group.media:title: VR Environments for Collaborative Software Development
media:group.media:description:
In this podcast, Shane Hastie, Lead Editor for Culture & Methods spoke to Jonathan Schneider and the development team from Moderne about their experiences using an immersive VR environment for collaborative software development.
This podcast was recorded as a video of the immersive experience.

entry.title: Level up Your Java Performance with TornadoVM

entry.title: Roy Rapoport on Canary Analysis at Netflix

media:group.media:title: Roy Rapoport on Canary Analysis at Netflix
media:group.media:description:
Interview with transcript available on InfoQ: https://bit.ly/3Rj0m2m
Roy Rapoport manages the Insight Engineering group at Netflix, responsible for building Netflix's Operational Insight platforms, including cloud telemetry, alerting, and real-time analytics". He originally joined Netflix as part of its datacenter-based IT/Ops group, and prior to transferring over to Product Engineering, was managing Service Delivery for IT/Ops.
#Netflix #ContinuousDeployment #AgileTechniques --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Follow InfoQ: - Twitter: https://www.twitter.com/infoq - LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/company/infoq/ - Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/InfoQdotcom/ - Instagram: @infoqdotcom

entry.title: Culture and the Games People Play

media:group.media:title: Culture and the Games People Play
media:group.media:description:
Adopt the right emerging trends to solve your complex engineering challenges at QCon London March 27-29, 2022. Get practical inspiration and best practices on how to implement emerging software trends directly from senior software developers at early adopter companies.
Learn the emerging trends. Explore the use cases. Implement the best practices.
Save your spot now: https://bit.ly/3Rvcpda --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Video on InfoQ: https://bit.ly/3DKldIH
Roy Rapoport demonstrates the power of alignment (or lack thereof) using real-world examples from previous and current employer, with specific emphasis on his experience introducing Python to production use within Netflix, the organizational structures he interacted with through that process, and the way they tie into Netflix's formal culture.
This presentation was recorded at QCon San Francisco 2015.
#Culture #Netflix #OrganizationalPatterns ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ Follow InfoQ: - Twitter: https://www.twitter.com/infoq - LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/company/infoq/ - Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/InfoQdotcom/ - Instagram: @infoqdotcom

entry.title: Principles of Green Software Engineering with Marco Valtas

media:group.media:title: Principles of Green Software Engineering with Marco Valtas
media:group.media:description:
In this episode, Marco Valtas, technical lead for cleantech and sustainability at ThoughtWorks North America, discusses the Principles of Green Software Engineering. The principles help guide software decisions by considering the environmental impact. The principles are intended for everyone involved in software and emphasize that sustainability, on its own, is a reason to justify the work.
Read a transcript of this interview: https://bit.ly/3b0hpY8
Subscribe to our newsletters: - The InfoQ weekly newsletter: https://bit.ly/24x3IVq - The Software Architects’ Newsletter [monthly]: https://www.infoq.com/software-architects-newsletter/

entry.title: Omar Sanseviero on Transformer Models and Democratizing Good ML Practices

media:group.media:title: Omar Sanseviero on Transformer Models and Democratizing Good ML Practices
media:group.media:description:
Live from the venue of the QCon London Conference we are talking with Omar Sanseviero about Hugging Face, the limitations and biases of machine learning models, the carbon emitted when training large scale machine learning models, and democratizing good ML practices.
Read a transcript of this interview: https://bit.ly/3yTMFjc
